content: The following is a **list of reservoirs in Singapore**. There are currently 17 [reservoirs](/wiki/Reservoirs) which are designated as national [water catchment](/wiki/Drainage_basin) areas and are managed by the [Public Utilities Board](/wiki/Public_Utilities_Board_(Singapore)) (PUB) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## Reservoirs NameSurface area (total)Storage capacity (m3)Period of constructionConstruction orderImageRemarks[Bedok Reservoir](/wiki/Bedok_Reservoir)88 [ha](/wiki/Hectare)12,800,0001981-198614[Jurong Lake](/wiki/Jurong_Lake)70 ha11In addition to a number of artificial islands such as the [Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_Garden,_Singapore) and [Japanese Gardens](/wiki/Japanese_Garden,_Singapore), Jurong Lake is planned to be a future recreational hub for the western side of the island.[Kranji Reservoir](/wiki/Kranji_Reservoir)450 ha15,850,0001971-19755[Lower Peirce Reservoir](/wiki/Lower_Peirce_Reservoir) (formerly called "Kallang River Reservoir" and "Peirce Reservoir")6 ha2,800,0001900-19122Source of the [Kallang River](/wiki/Kallang_River), Singapore's longest river. Connects to [Upper Thomson Road](/wiki/Upper_Thomson_Road) by a waterside trail.[Lower Seletar Reservoir](/wiki/Lower_Seletar_Reservoir)360 ha9,400,0001941-196913[MacRitchie Reservoir](/wiki/MacRitchie_Reservoir) (formerly called "Thomson Road Reservoir")4,200,0001890-18941[Marina Reservoir](/wiki/Marina_Reservoir)240 ha2005-200815[Murai Reservoir](/wiki/Murai_Reservoir)[note 1]1977-19817[Pandan Reservoir](/wiki/Pandan_Reservoir)1971-19746[Poyan Reservoir](/wiki/Poyan_Reservoir)[note 1]1977-19818[Pulau Tekong Reservoir](/wiki/Pulau_Tekong_Reservoir)[note 1]1977-197912[Punggol Reservoir](/wiki/Punggol_Reservoir)16Opening ceremony held on 3 July 2011. Together with Serangoon Reservoir will increase catchment area by 5,500ha.[Sarimbun Reservoir](/wiki/Sarimbun_Reservoir)[note 1]1977-19819[Serangoon Reservoir](/wiki/Serangoon_Reservoir)17Opening ceremony held on 3 July 2011. Together with Punggol Reservoir will increase catchment area by 5,500ha.[Tengeh Reservoir](/wiki/Tengeh_Reservoir)[note 1]1977-198110[Upper Peirce Reservoir](/wiki/Upper_Peirce_Reservoir)304 ha27,800,0004[Upper Seletar Reservoir](/wiki/Upper_Seletar_Reservoir) (formerly called "Seletar Reservoir")324 ha3 ## Reservoirs that are currently in service ## Reservoirs that are no longer in service - [Mount Emily Reservoir](/wiki/Mount_Emily_Reservoir) - [Keppel Hill Reservoir](/wiki/Keppel_Hill_Reservoir) ## Notes
title: List of dams and reservoirs in Singapore
